content.prompt: Which of the following explains why a decrease in the price of a normal good will lead to an increase in the quantity demanded of the good?

choices.label: A lower price will increase consumers’ purchasing power.
A lower price will increase consumers’ marginal utility.
A lower price will increase demand for the good.
A lower price will increase demand for substitute goods.
A lower price will decrease demand for complementary goods.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
